title.rendered: Two LAWS Volunteers Win Osgoode Gold Key Awards

content.rendered:
Congratulations to Osgoode Hall Law students and LAWS volunteers Jean-Paul Bevilacqua and Toby Samson, who are the recipients of 2015 Gold Keys Awards. Well done Toby and JP, and thank you for all of your great work with LAWS! 
 
From Y-File: 
"The Dean's 'Gold Keys' are awarded annually to students graduating from the Juris Doctor (JD) program at Osgoode Hall Law School. Recipients are those students who have made an outstanding contribution to the life of the law school, either to the academic program of the school or other activities that are integral to the community. Recipients have demonstrated exceptional leadership, commitment, and enthusiasm through their participation in extracurricular activities, law school or University governance."
 
Click here to read the Y-File article.
